posts.name: Jaclyn
posts.cooked:
We are currently competing with the new REV aluminum wheels on our REV MAX SWERVE and have noticed a lot of wear on them.

20230407_122742 1920×1081 140 KB 20230407_122714 1920×3410 313 KB

20230407_122742 1920×1081 140 KB

20230407_122742 1920×1081 140 KB

20230407_122714 1920×3410 313 KB

20230407_122714 1920×3410 313 KB

All the wheels are experiencing this damage. Do other teams who are using/have used them have any insight.

For reference we used the recommended black neoprene from McMaster, here is an image of a fresh wheel.

20230407_123831 1920×3410 658 KB 20230407_123834 1920×3410 762 KB

20230407_123831 1920×3410 658 KB

20230407_123831 1920×3410 658 KB

20230407_123834 1920×3410 762 KB

20230407_123834 1920×3410 762 KB
What kind of black tread did you get, is it hard or soft to the touch when new? The hard stuff works well. The soft stuff is really bad.

posts.name: Jaclyn
posts.cooked: McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.
Well idk from the spec. What does it feel like in your hand? Does it have a squish to it?
Thin flanges are subject to wear, however, they generally don’t affect performance. The flanges SDS wheels last year wore/broke in a similar manner and there was no noticeable performance drop.
We have similar wear on our wheels. It hasn’t caused any issues for us in the ~40 matches we’ve been using them.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Has anyone tried the 1" wide AndyMark tread?  We measured the width and they aren’t quite one inch.  And there is the small “ridge” on the outer part of the wheel that would prevent the tread from sitting properly?

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked:
You need to shave off about 1/8 of an inch of the AM treads to get them to fit.

Thriftybot sells 1" aluminum wheels for the MaxSwerve.

As for general wear on the wheels, we found that it was very much related to how aggressively our drivers drove over the charge station. Lots of hard aluminum tubing on that thing that the wheels collided with.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Sweet!  Watched the install video.  Can’t wait to print off that template.
